recently_narrative: The Zendesk ecosystem updates over the past 3 weeks suggest that the company is focused on expanding its AI capabilities, with announcements of new Copilot recommendation types and an upcoming Zendesk AI Summit. However, this push for AI-powered features appears to be accompanied by a series of service incidents, including issues with GCP adherence, assignments getting stuck, and workflow disruptions. These stability challenges underscore the tensions Zendesk professionals may face as the company navigates the transition towards a more AI-driven contact center experience. Despite these challenges, Zendesk is also introducing new permissions, connectors, and administrative tools, indicating a broader effort to enhance platform functionality and usability for its users.

release_notes.summary: This week's release notes introduce a new page in Admin Center that displays external OAuth clients used to authenticate and connect to Zendesk accounts. As part of the ongoing removal of password access for API authentication, accounts without recent usage of this feature have had the capability proactively turned off and removed. Accounts that disable password access will now automatically be enrolled in two-step verification, with the final phase of this rollout beginning in October. Additionally, the default content for the welcome email has been updated for new accounts. The Copilot add-on has also been expanded with 15 new recommendation types.

article.title: Release notes through 2025-08-29
